head.title: Trooper Charged With Rape Kills Himself

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Law Enforcement and Security

hedline.hl1: Trooper Charged With Rape Kills Himself

block.p: A sergeant dismissed by the California Highway Patrol apparently killed himself a month after he was arrested on charges that he had raped a woman in his cruiser, the authorities said today.

Two joggers found the sergeant, James W. Pitsor, 49, on a dirt road about 5 P.M. on Wednesday, said a spokesman for the San Bernardino County Sheriff's Department, Tom Neely. Sergeant Pitsor apparently shot himself, the authorities said. Foul play was not indicated. The Desert Dispatch of Barstow, quoting police officers it did not name, said the trooper had used a rifle.
A sergeant dismissed by the California Highway Patrol apparently killed himself a month after he was arrested on charges that he had raped a woman in his cruiser, the authorities said today.

Two joggers found the sergeant, James W. Pitsor, 49, on a dirt road about 5 P.M. on Wednesday, said a spokesman for the San Bernardino County Sheriff's Department, Tom Neely. Sergeant Pitsor apparently shot himself, the authorities said. Foul play was not indicated. The Desert Dispatch of Barstow, quoting police officers it did not name, said the trooper had used a rifle.
Sergeant Pitsor, who had worked in the Barstow office for 17 years and was named its 1995 officer of the year, was dismissed on Monday.

He was arrested on Dec. 10, the day after the woman accused him of driving her 20 miles into the desert and raping her. She said they had met as she walked in the downtown area at night, and he had offered to drive her home. The woman, who was driven back to Barstow after the assault, identified Sergeant Pitsor by the name on his badge.
